alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:40AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Nicholas, east central Kanawha, southwestern Clay and northwestern Fayette Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 340 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coal Fork, or 10 miles east of Charleston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Chesapeake, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Glen, Coal Fork, Handley, Bickmore, Swiss, Indore, Bentree and Pond Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
